name: (1Z)-1-[(2E)-1-benzyl-3-phenyl-2-(phenylhydrazono)propylidene]-2-phenylhydrazine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-960
Reason: 1. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. 2. The compound has a phenyl group, which increases the melting point due to pi-pi interactions and rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. 3. The presence of a benzyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to enhance the crystalline structure and increase molecular weight. The benzyl group may add around +20 to +30°C. 4. The hydrazono group can participate in hydrogen bonding, which can lower the melting point by around -10 to -20°C. 5. The propylidene group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to enhance the crystalline structure and increase molecular weight. The propylidene group may add around +10 to +20°C.
